title.narrative: 9th Actuarial Review of the National Insurance Scheme as at 31 December 2016

description.narrative: The conduct of the 9th Actuarial Review of the National Insurance Scheme (NIS) as at 31 December 2016 is primarily aimed at assisting the Board of the NIS in ensuring the long-term financial sustainability of the Scheme. The Actuarial valuation is mandated by statute and its report is a public document which serves to inform stakeholders of the current and projected financial status of the Scheme. The project covers actuarial valuation services for the Long-term benefits branch (old-age, invalidity and constant attendance benefits, survivors and funeral benefits) and the Short-term benefits branch (sickness, maternity and sickness benefits) to be provided by the Actuarial Services Unit of the Social Protection Department (SOC/ASU) and the Industrial benefits branch (injury, disablement and death benefits) to be provided by the Actuarial Services of the Global Employment Injury Programme of the Enterprises Department (ENT/GEIP). The Social Policy Unit (SOC/POL) of SOCPRO will also support the project for final clearance on conclusions and policy recommendations.

department.narrative: Departement of Partnerships and Field Support (PARDEV)

sector.narrative: ILO Results Framework 2020-2021: Output 8.1. Increased capacity of member States to develop new or reformed sustainable national social protection strategies, policies or legal frameworks to extend coverage and enhance benefit adequacy

transaction.ref: GUY/17/01/GUY-2019-GUY153 - Improved the institutional or regulatory framework to strengthen governance, financial management or sustainability for the delivery of equitable social protection
